title_sort: walt whitman to richard maurice bucke, 24 december 1890
title: Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 24 December 1890
text: CamdenDec: 24 '90Y'rs rec'd: ab't the catheter &c:—thanks—Am feeling tolerably easy—bowel voidance—clear sunny weather here—Horace is sending his piece to N[ew] E[ngland] Magazine—I send MS "Some Personal Memoranda" & a poemet to Lippincott's intended for March—I have also sent (did I tell you?) some poetic tuff to Scribner's—McKay has paid me for the 100 big book sets sheets went to England—Enclose Dr J[ohnston]'s letter came last evn'g—(good friends, set there in Bolton)—letter this mn'g f'm Ed Wilkins, welcomed—Christmas at hand—(a sort of general prosperity & "intestinal agitation")—Looks fine out & I sh'l likely get in wheel chair—God bless you all—Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 24 December 1890
